News.Title: Usha Martin Reports 19.1% EBITDA Margin in Q2 FY26 with Strong Cash Generation
News.Summary: Usha Martin achieved consolidated revenue of INR 908 crore in Q2 FY26 with operating EBITDA of INR 173 crore at 19.1% margin, driven by Wire Rope segment's 2.6% growth and Wires segment's 14.2% growth, while LRPC division declined 26%. The company turned net cash positive with INR 111 crore, repaying INR 157 crore debt through internal accruals and generating robust operating cash flows of INR 390 crore with 123% EBITDA to cash conversion.

News.Title: Usha Martin Limited Modifies Employee Welfare Trust, Appoints New Trustees
News.Summary: Usha Martin Limited has modified its Employee Welfare Trust deed to change trustees. The company appointed Ashwin Lakhani and Shahbaz Anwar Warsi as new trustees, replacing Gouri Shankar Rathi and Dhanraj Parihar. The supplemental trust deed was executed on November 8, 2025, under SEBI regulations for share-based employee benefits. The trust was originally established on September 23, 2024, to implement equity-based incentive and employee welfare schemes, including the Usha Martin Limited Employee Stock Option Plan-2024. All other provisions of the original trust deed remain unchanged except for the trustee composition.

News.Title: Usha Martin Reports Quarterly Results with Ongoing Legal Proceedings
News.Summary: Usha Martin Limited announced its quarterly results for the quarter and half year ended September 30, 2025. The Board of Directors approved the unaudited financial results (standalone and consolidated) at their meeting held on November 8, 2025. The company continues to face legal proceedings including attachment of certain land parcels at Ranchi under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act, 2002 (PMLA) worth Rs. 19,037 lakhs related to iron ore sales. The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has filed charges under the Prevention of Corruption Act, 1988 and Indian Penal Code, 1860 against the company and certain personnel. The company has received summons from the Enforcement Directorate regarding PMLA provisions. Management believes the company has a strong case and no adjustments to financial results have been made. The company's ongoing operations remain unaffected by these proceedings.

News.Title: Usha Martin Reports Steady Q2 Performance with Revenue Growth
News.Summary: Usha Martin reported Q2 consolidated net profit of 1.1 billion rupees, matching the previous year's figure. Revenue increased to 9.07 billion rupees from 8.91 billion rupees year-over-year. EBITDA rose to 1.73 billion rupees compared to 1.61 billion rupees in the same period last year. The company's EBITDA margin improved to 19.06% from 18.04% year-over-year.

News.Title: Usha Martin Shareholders Approve Remuneration Revisions for Two Whole-Time Directors via Postal Ballot
News.Summary: Usha Martin Limited announced that shareholders have approved two special resolutions through postal ballot voting. The first resolution approved revision in remuneration for Whole-Time Director Sharng Bhrit Prasanna Bhanu Pratap Narayan Sharma (DIN: 08167106) effective from April 1, 2025, with 99.96% votes in favor. The second resolution approved remuneration revision for Whole-Time Director Chirantan Chatterjee (DIN: 10506056) effective from May 12, 2025, with 99.96% votes in favor. A total of 488 members representing 181,485,166 equity shares participated in the remote e-voting process. The voting period was from October 9, 2025 to November 7, 2025. The scrutinizer's report was prepared by Raj Kumar Banthia from MKB Associates.

News.Title: Usha Martin Announces Release of USD 5 Million Corporate Guarantee by Export Import Bank of India

News.Title: Usha Martin Schedules Q2 H1 FY26 Earnings Conference Call for November 10, 2025

The company operates wire rope manufacturing facilities in Ranchi, Hoshiarpur, Dubai, Bangkok and UK, and has a global R&D center in Italy. Usha Martin is listed on NSE (USHAMART), BSE (517146), and Luxembourg Stock Exchange (US9173002042).

News.Title: Usha Martin Reports 7.4% Revenue Growth in Q1 FY26 Despite Net Profit Decline
News.Summary: Usha Martin Limited reported consolidated revenue of Rs. 887 crore for Q1 FY26, up 7.4% year-on-year, driven by 10.4% volume growth across key segments. The company achieved operating EBITDA of Rs. 145 crore with a margin of 16.3%. However, net profit declined to Rs. 101 crore from Rs. 104 crore in Q1 FY25. The wire ropes segment, contributing 72% of total revenue, grew 7.9% while the wire segment registered strong 32.3% growth. The LRPC segment faced headwinds with a 3.4% revenue decline. The company's 'One Usha Martin' transformation program foundational phase is largely complete, with more tangible benefits expected in H2 FY26. Management targets 18% EBITDA margin for full year FY26 and 19-20% margins for FY27. The company faces challenges from 50% US tariffs on steel wire ropes but remains optimistic about passing costs to customers. New capacity expansion of 40,000 tons is underway, including 20,000 tons of rope capacity at the Ranchi plant.

News.Title: Usha Martin Targets Growth Through Strategic Expansion and Global Orders
News.Summary: Usha Martin is implementing a 'One Usha Martin' strategy to drive growth, alongside expanding its Ranchi facility capacity. The company reports strong global orders and has achieved net-debt-free status. High international demand positions the company for rapid growth expected to begin in H2 FY26.

News.Title: Usha Martin Reports Quarterly Results with Revenue of Rs 88,719 Lakhs
News.Summary: Usha Martin Limited's Board approved unaudited financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. The company reported consolidated revenue from operations of Rs 88,719 lakhs and profit after tax of Rs 10,081 lakhs for the quarter. The Wire & Wire Ropes segment generated revenue of Rs 87,075 lakhs while Others segment contributed Rs 1,644 lakhs. Earnings per share stood at Rs 3.31 for the quarter. The company faces ongoing legal proceedings related to land attachment under Prevention of Money Laundering Act concerning iron ore sales aggregating Rs 19,037 lakhs, with hearings scheduled for August 28, 2025 and September 8, 2025. Management believes the company has a strong legal case and no financial adjustments have been made regarding these proceedings.

News.Title: Usha Martin Reports Q4 FY23 Financial Results
News.Summary: Usha Martin has released its Q4 financial results. The company reported revenue of 8.96 billion rupees, up from 8.29 billion rupees year-over-year. However, EBITDA decreased to 1.39 billion rupees from 1.52 billion rupees in the same period last year. The EBITDA margin also declined to 15.58% from 18.28% year-over-year.

News.Title: Usha Martin Reports Decline in Q3 EBITDA and Margin

Additionally, the EBITDA margin contracted to 16.58% from 19.70% year-over-year, indicating a reduction in profitability.
